experiment: F-CON2 soft-claim protocol — tools/claim.py implementation S352
expect: claim.py working: claim/check/release/list/gc subcommands; workspace/claims/ dir; tested on DUE scenarios

tests_run.test: conflict: session B tries to claim same file

actual: 5/5 tests pass. Conflict detection works. TTL auto-expiry prevents deadlock from crashed sessions.
diff: Expected 67% C-EDIT prevention. Tool covers DUE-convergence (main vector, 50% of collisions). Staged-contamination (file-level) needs caller discipline. Implementation simpler than expected — no database needed.
note: Usage pattern: before editing DUE item, call claim.py claim <file>. In check.sh DUE surfacing, add claim hint. Auto-GC via gc subcommand prevents stale lockout.
integration_hint: Add to check.sh: when surfacing DUE items, suggest: python3 tools/claim.py claim <file> before editing
